page.title: 01CASSOP & QUARRINGTON AREA
page.content: The area is situated East of Durham City.Although it now appears to be rural it was a centre of both coal mining and quarrying until recently. Two limestome quarries are working and the last pit closed in 1983.The block is mainly rolling countrside with cattle grazing the hill pastures of the magnesian limestone escarpment and barley growing on the lower land.The two princpal settlements are Cassop & Quarrington Hill,each of around 300 houses.They are mainly council houses built around 1940 as replacments for the colliery housing of around 1850.Old Cassop, a cluster of farms,is the original village and a farm remains in Old Quarrington a ancient settlement.Despite the fact that the villages have few amenities and little employment there is a strong sense of community ,few leave.
